010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012//import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.stat.correlation.Covariance;
014
015/**
016 * This class defines static methods for statistical calculations.
017 * 
018 * @author WB
019 *
020 */
021public abstract class Statistics {
022        
023        private Statistics() {}
024
025        /**
026         * Calculates the covariance matrix for a sequence of sample vectors. Takes a sequence of n data samples, each of
027         * dimension m. The data element {@code samples[i][j]} refers to the j-th component of sample i. No statistical bias
028         * correction is applied.
029         *
030         * @param samples a 2D array of m-dimensional vectors (double[n][m]).
031         * @return the covariance matrix for the sample data (of dimension m x m).
032         */
033        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] samples) {
034                return covarianceMatrix(samples, false);
035        }
036
037        /**
038         * Calculates the covariance matrix for a sequence of sample vectors. Takes a sequence of n data samples, each of
039         * dimension m. The data element {@code samples[i][j]} refers to the j-th component of sample i. Statistical bias
040         * correction is optionally applied.
041         *
042         * @param samples a 2D array of m-dimensional vectors (double[n][m]).
043         * @param biasCorrect If {@code true}, statistical bias correction is applied.
044         * @return the covariance matrix for the sample data (of dimension m x m).
045         */
046        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] samples, boolean biasCorrect) {
047                Covariance cov = new Covariance(samples, biasCorrect);
048                return cov.getCovarianceMatrix().getData();
049        }
050        
051//      /** 
052//       * example from UTICS-C Appendix:
053//       * N = 4 samples
054//       * K = 3 dimensions
055//       * @param args ignored
056//       */
057//      public static void main(String[] args) {
058//              
059//              boolean BIAS_CORRECT = false;
060//              
061//              // example: n = 4 samples of dimension m = 3:
062//              // samples[i][j], i = column (sample index), j = row (dimension index).
063//              double[][] samples = { 
064//                              {75, 37, 12},   // i = 0
065//                              {41, 27, 20},   // i = 1
066//                              {93, 81, 11},   // i = 2
067//                              {12, 48, 52}    // i = 3
068//              };
069//              
070//              // covariance matrix Cov (3x3)
071//              double[][] cov = covarianceMatrix(samples, BIAS_CORRECT);
072//              System.out.println("cov = \n" + Matrix.toString(cov));
073//              
074//              System.out.println();
075//              
076//              double[][] icov = Matrix.inverse(cov);
077//              System.out.println("icov = \n" + Matrix.toString(icov));
078//              
079//              System.out.println();
080//              
081//              double trace = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(cov).getTrace();
082//              System.out.println("trace(cov) = " + trace);
083//              double Fnorm = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(cov).getFrobeniusNorm();
084//              System.out.println("Fnorm(cov) = " + Fnorm);
085//      }
086        
087/* Results (bias-corrected):
088cov = 
089{{1296.250, 442.583, -627.250}, 
090{442.583, 550.250, -70.917}, 
091{-627.250, -70.917, 370.917}}
092
093icov = 
094{{0.024, -0.014, 0.038}, 
095{-0.014, 0.011, -0.022}, 
096{0.038, -0.022, 0.063}}
097*/
098        
099/* verified with Mathematica
100X1 = {75, 37, 12}; X2 = {41, 27, 20}; X3 = {93, 81, 11}; X4 = {12, 48, 52};
101samples = {X1, X2, X3, X4}
102N[Covariance[samples]]
103-> {{1296.25, 442.583, -627.25}, {442.583, 550.25, -70.9167}, {-627.25, -70.9167, 370.917}}
104*/
105        
106/* Results (NON bias-corrected):
107cov = 
108{{972.188, 331.938, -470.438}, 
109{331.938, 412.688, -53.188}, 
110{-470.438, -53.188, 278.188}}
111
112icov = {{0.032, -0.019, 0.051}, 
113{-0.019, 0.014, -0.030}, 
114{0.051, -0.030, 0.083}}
115*/
116
117}
